entry.title: The 15th International Conference on Finite-State Methods and Natural Language Processing

entry.content:
The international conference series "Finite-State Methods and Natural Language Processing" (FSMNLP) is the premier forum of the ACL Special Interest Group on Finite-State Methods (SIGFSM). SIGFSM serves researchers and practitioners in natural language processing (NLP) working on:

  • natural language processing (implementation, applications, language resources),
  • theoretical aspects, or
  • combinations thereof,

that have obvious relevance or an explicit relation to finite-state methods.

Dates and Invited Program

FSMNLP 2023 will be held (dates preliminary) August 28-30 in Stellenbosch, South Africa

Invited talks/tutorials:

  • To be determined.

Adjacency to IJCAI 2023

Note that FSMNLP runs the days just after the completion of International Joint Conferences on Artificial Intelligence 2023, which is arranged in Cape Town August 19th through the 25th. Cape Town is a short car ride from Stellenbosch, making attending both events very practical.

Registration

Registration will carry a (reasonable) fee this year.
